Launch the HAI Dashboard (German PPS 2011)

launch_app.Rd

Starts the Shiny application bundled with the package. The app provides an interactive overview of healthcare-associated infections (HAIs) from the German point-prevalence survey (PPS) 2011, including total cases by infection type and distributions of length of infection.

Usage

launch_app()

Value

Opens the Shiny app in your browser.

Tabs

  • Cases (interactive) – Bar chart of HAI cases by type with hover tooltips showing the standardized rate per 1,000 survey patients.

  • Length of Infection – Histogram of infection durations (days) for the selected infection type.

  • About \& How to Read – Plain-language descriptions of fields, definitions, and interpretation guidance.

Top metrics

  • Survey Patients: total patients included in the PPS snapshot.

  • Population (2011): national population (context).

  • Mean Length of Stay: average hospital stay in days.

Data sources

The app uses objects from the BHAI example dataset german_pps_2011_repr at runtime: num_survey_patients, population, length_of_stay, num_hai_patients, loi_pps. A convenience table df_cases (cases and rate per 1,000) is derived inside the app. If you instead ship precomputed data objects in AndyWebsite, see ?df_cases, ?metrics, and ?loi_by_type.

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
  launch_app()
} # }
